explaining: The word "great" in English is an adjective that is used to describe something that is exceptionally good, impressive, or important. It can refer to someone or something that excels in a particular way or possesses admirable qualities. "Great" is often used to convey a sense of excellence, magnitude, or importance in various contexts.
examplePhrases: She did a great job on her project.
It was a great movie that we watched last night.
He has a great sense of humor.
We had a great time at the party.
The view from the top of the mountain was truly great.

explaining: The word "same" in English refers to things that are identical or exactly alike in some way. It is often used to indicate that two or more things are not different from each other. For example, "We have the same taste in music" means that two people share similar music preferences.
examplePhrases: I have the same backpack as my friend.
We ordered the same dish at the restaurant.
The twins have the same birthday.
Can you pass me the same book you were reading?
Our opinions on the matter are the same.

explaining: The word "big" in English is an adjective that is used to describe something that is large in size, quantity, extent, or importance. It is often used to compare the size of objects, people, or concepts. It can also be used informally to emphasize the magnitude or significance of something.
examplePhrases: She has a big heart.
That's a big problem.
He has a big house.
I need a big favor from you.
The company made a big profit this year.

explaining: In English, the word "group" refers to a collection of people or things that are gathered or classified together based on similarities or shared characteristics. It can also indicate a formal organization or association of individuals working towards a common goal or interest. Overall, a group signifies a unified entity formed by individuals or items with a common purpose or trait.
examplePhrases: We will be working in a group on this project.
The students formed a study group to prepare for the exam.
The tour guide divided us into smaller groups for the museum visit.
There is a group of protestors standing outside the building.
She belongs to a hiking group that meets every weekend.

explaining: "Begin" is a verb that means to start or commence an action, event, or process. It is used to indicate when something is starting or initiating. The word "begin" is often used to signal the first step of a sequence or the start of an activity.
examplePhrases: Let's begin the lesson with a warm-up activity.
I will begin my presentation by introducing the main topic.
We should begin the project as soon as possible.
The event will begin at 6:00 PM sharp.
When will you begin studying for your exam?

explaining: The word "seem" is a verb that means to give the impression of being a certain way or having a particular quality. It is often used to describe something that appears to be the case based on what is observed or experienced. "Seem" is frequently used to express uncertainty or subjective perception.
examplePhrases: It seems like it's going to rain today.
She seems to be upset about something.
This restaurant seems to be popular among locals.
He seems tired after a long day at work.
The situation seems to be getting worse.

explaining: In English, the word "country" most commonly refers to a nation or a sovereign state that has a defined territory with its own government, laws, and borders. It can also refer to a rural or agricultural area outside of cities and towns. Additionally, "country" can be used informally to describe the countryside or a region with distinct characteristics or culture.
examplePhrases: I love traveling to different countries.
Canada is a beautiful country with diverse landscapes.
Our country's economy is facing some challenges.
She proudly represented her country at the Olympics.
We should always show respect for our country's flag.

explaining: "Help" in English means to assist someone in need, to support or aid them in accomplishing a task or problem. It is an action taken to make things easier or better for another person. Providing help often involves offering guidance, resources, or physical assistance to someone who requires it.
examplePhrases: I need help with my homework.
Can you help me carry these boxes?
Please help me understand this math problem.
Thank you for your help earlier.
She always offers to help others in need.

explaining: "Talk" is a verb that means to communicate with someone by speaking. It can also refer to a conversation or discussion between people. Additionally, "talk" can be used to describe delivering a speech or lecture on a specific topic.
examplePhrases: Let's talk about your progress in class.
I need to talk to you about an important matter.
I enjoy talking to my friends on the phone.
Can we schedule a time to talk about your project?
It's important to talk openly and honestly with your family.

explaining: "Where" is an interrogative adverb used to ask about a place or location. It is frequently used to inquire about the specific spot or position of something. In English, "where" helps to indicate the whereabouts of a person, object, or event.
examplePhrases: Can you tell me where the nearest grocery store is?
I don't know where my keys are.
Do you remember where we parked the car?
This is the park where we had our first picnic.
I will meet you at the place where we first met.

explaining: The word "turn" in English can have various meanings depending on the context. It can refer to changing direction or orientation, taking one's opportunity in a sequence or order, or making a decision or choice. It is a versatile word that is commonly used in everyday language to convey different actions and situations.
examplePhrases: It's your turn to speak now.
Please turn off the lights before leaving.
I will turn the volume up on the TV.
She took a wrong turn and got lost.
They decided to turn their hobby into a business.

explaining: In English, the word "problem" refers to a matter or situation that needs to be solved or dealt with. It can signify an issue or obstacle that presents a challenge or difficulty. Identifying, analyzing, and finding a solution to a problem is a common process in various aspects of life.
examplePhrases: I have a problem with my computer, it keeps crashing.
She passed the exam without any problems.
The main problem with this project is the lack of funding.
I need your help to solve this problem.
Ignoring the problem will only make it worse.

explaining: The word "every" is used to refer to all members of a group individually, one by one. It emphasizes each and every single one within a group or a set. For example, "I go to the gym every day" means that the speaker goes to the gym each day, without exception.
examplePhrases: I brush my teeth every morning.
The supermarket is closed every Sunday.
She exercises every day to stay healthy.
We have a meeting every Friday afternoon.
They visit their grandparents every summer.

explaining: The word "start" in English is a verb that means to begin something or to initiate an action or process. It can also refer to the point in time when something commences or when an activity begins. Additionally, "start" can indicate the initial stage of an event, journey, or task.
examplePhrases: Let's start the meeting now.
I will start working on the project tomorrow.
What time does the movie start?
She will start her new job next week.
Don't forget to start the car before driving.

explaining: The word "hand" in English refers to the body part at the end of the arm that includes the fingers and thumb. It is used for tasks such as grasping, holding, and manipulating objects. "Hand" can also be used figuratively to suggest assistance, help, or involvement in a situation.
examplePhrases: Please wash your hands before eating.
She held the baby's hand as they crossed the street.
I write with my right hand.
He raised his hand to ask a question.
The book is too heavy to hold with one hand.

explaining: "Might" in English is a modal verb that is used to indicate possibility or probability. It can suggest that something is more tentative or less certain than if the word "will" was used. For example, "I might go to the store later" implies that there is a possibility that the speaker will go to the store, but it is not definite.
examplePhrases: I might go to the beach tomorrow if the weather is nice.
She might be running late for the meeting.
We might have pizza for dinner tonight.
It might rain later, so bring an umbrella.
He might not have received your email yet.

explaining: The word "American" refers to someone or something from or related to the United States of America. It typically describes the people, culture, customs, or products originating from the U.S. The term "American" can also be used to denote the continent of America or its inhabitants in a broader sense.
examplePhrases: I am proud to be an American citizen.
American culture is diverse and vibrant.
She is studying American history in school.
The American flag has red, white, and blue colors.
Many famous actors and musicians are American.

explaining: In English, the word "show" is a verb that means to display or exhibit something to others. It can also refer to an event or performance where entertainment is provided to an audience. Additionally, "show" can be a noun indicating a spectacle or presentation, such as a TV show or a fashion show.
examplePhrases: Can you show me how to solve this math problem?
The movie will be shown at 7 PM tonight.
She showed great determination to finish the race.
The presentation will showcase the latest products from the company.
His actions clearly show that he is not to be trusted.

explaining: The word "part" in English refers to a piece or portion of something larger. It can also refer to a role or character in a play, movie, or performance. Additionally, "part" can be used to indicate a division or section of a whole.
examplePhrases: I need you to complete your part of the group project.
She plays a crucial part in the decision-making process.
Can you show me where the missing part goes?
He is a part of the school basketball team.
Let's all do our part to keep the environment clean.

explaining: "Against" is a preposition in English that indicates opposition, resistance, or contradiction to something. It is often used to show that someone or something is opposed to or in conflict with a particular idea, action, or person. For example, "She is against the new policy," means that she does not support or agree with the new policy.
examplePhrases: He leaned against the wall.
She spoke out against the proposed changes.
The team is playing against their rivals tonight.
I have nothing against trying new things.
The decision went against my recommendation.

explaining: In English, the word "place" typically refers to a specific location or position in space. It can be used to indicate a physical area, a spot or area designated for a specific purpose, or as a verb to describe putting something somewhere. The word "place" can also be used more figuratively to convey a sense of importance or significance in a social or hierarchical context.
examplePhrases: I need to find a new place to live.
Let's meet at the usual place for lunch.
This is a beautiful place to visit during the summer.
Can you save me a place in line?
I'll put this book back in its proper place on the shelf.

explaining: The word "such" is often used as a determiner to emphasize the quality or degree of something. It is typically used before a noun to show similarity or comparison. For example, "She had never tasted such delicious food before."
examplePhrases: I have never seen such a beautiful sunset before.
She has such a kind heart.
They faced such difficult challenges during the expedition.
I cannot believe that such a small child could be so intelligent.
Such behavior is unacceptable in this school.

explaining: The word "again" is an adverb in English that is used to indicate a repeated action or event. It suggests a return to a previous state or situation. For example, "Let's watch the movie again" means let's watch the movie one more time.
examplePhrases: I missed my bus, so I had to wait for another one to come again.
Can you please repeat that information again, I didn't catch it the first time.
After failing the test, she studied hard to try again and improve her grade.
We enjoyed the movie so much that we decided to watch it again the next day.
He promised to never make that mistake again and learn from it.

explaining: The word "few" in English refers to a small number of something. It is used to indicate a small quantity or amount of items or people. For example, if you say, "I have a few friends coming over," it means that there are not many friends, just a small number.
examplePhrases: There were only a few people at the party.
She needed just a few more minutes to finish her work.
I have a few questions about the project.
I saw a few interesting movies last weekend.
There are a few apples left in the basket.

explaining: In English, the word "case" can have multiple meanings depending on the context it is used in. It can refer to a situation or set of circumstances involving a particular person or thing. It can also indicate a container, covering, or storage compartment for an object. Additionally, in the context of grammar, "case" can refer to the grammatical category of a noun, pronoun, or adjective showing its function in a sentence.
examplePhrases: In this case, it is best to seek professional help.
Let's consider the worst-case scenario.
She won the court case against her former employer.
The new phone comes with a protective case.
In any case, we should be prepared for all possibilities.

explaining: In English, the word "week" refers to a period of seven days, typically starting on a Sunday and ending on a Saturday. It is a unit of time commonly used for organizing schedules, appointments, work weeks, and other activities. The word "week" is derived from the Old English word "wice," meaning a change or a revolution, reflecting the cyclical nature of the seven-day period.
examplePhrases: I have a busy week ahead of me.
There are seven days in a week.
I see my friends every week.
She went on vacation last week.
The report is due at the end of the week.

explaining: The word "company" refers to an organization or business entity that engages in commercial, industrial, or professional activities for profit. It can also mean a group of people who come together for a particular purpose or activity. In a less formal sense, "company" can refer to companionship or being in the presence of others.
examplePhrases: I work for a software company.
I enjoy spending time with good company.
His company just launched a new product.
She is the CEO of a successful company.
We are hosting a company dinner next week.

explaining: In English, the word "system" refers to a set of connected parts or elements that work together to achieve a common goal. It can also describe a method or procedure for accomplishing something in an organized and efficient way. In everyday use, "system" often pertains to a structured or organized arrangement of components that function as a whole.
examplePhrases: The solar system consists of the sun, planets, and other celestial bodies.
Our school has a new grading system to track students' progress.
She has a great organizational system in place to keep track of her tasks.
The criminal justice system plays a crucial role in maintaining law and order.
The immune system helps protect our bodies from infections and diseases.

explaining: The word "each" is used to refer to every individual object or person in a group separately. It emphasizes the idea of considering or treating each individual element on its own. When "each" is used, it means that the action or attribute applies to every item or person in the group individually.
examplePhrases: Each student must hand in their assignment by tomorrow.
The chef carefully plated each dish before serving them to the guests.
They each received a gift as a token of appreciation.
We need to water each plant in the garden to help them grow.
Each member of the team has a specific role to play in the project.

explaining: "Right" can have multiple meanings in English. It can refer to the opposite of left, as in directions. It can also mean something is correct or morally justifiable. Additionally, "right" can be used to signify permission or entitlement, as in having the right to do something.
examplePhrases: Please turn right at the next intersection.
You have the right to remain silent.
I'll be right there.
She was right about the answer.
Make sure you are holding the pen in the right hand.

explaining: The word "program" in English can have multiple meanings. It can refer to a planned series of activities or events, often with a specific goal or purpose. In computing, a program is a set of instructions that the computer follows to perform a specific task. So, depending on the context, "program" can signify a schedule of events or a set of instructions for a computer.
examplePhrases: I'm attending a coding program at the local community college.
The school has a new program in place to promote student wellness.
The television program was a huge hit with viewers.
She is currently enrolled in a graduate program in psychology.
They are working on a program to improve access to clean water in rural areas.

explaining: The word "hear" in English means to perceive or receive sound through the ears. It involves the ability to listen and be aware of sounds in one's environment. Hearing is one of the five senses that allows us to interpret and understand sounds.
examplePhrases: I can hear the birds chirping outside.
Did you hear what he just said?
I hear music playing in the background.
Can you hear me now?
She couldn't hear the alarm ringing.

explaining: In English, the word "question" is a noun that refers to an inquiry or an act of asking for information or seeking an answer. It can also be used as a verb to denote the action of asking someone about something in order to obtain information or clarification. In general, a question is a form of communication used to elicit a response or to gain understanding on a particular topic.
examplePhrases: Please raise your hand if you have a question.
I have a question about the assignment due tomorrow.
She asked me a difficult question during the interview.
The professor encouraged us to ask questions during class.
Can I ask you a quick question about the project?

explaining: "During" is a preposition that indicates a period of time in which an action or event takes place. It is used to specify when something happens, offering a sense of timing or duration. For example, "During the summer, I like to go swimming" indicates that the action of swimming occurs in the time frame of summer.
examplePhrases: I like to read before bed during the week.
The students were attentive during the teacher's explanation.
The rain continued to fall during the entire concert.
I lost my keys during the chaos of the party.
She learned a new skill during her time abroad.

explaining: In English, the word "play" can have multiple meanings depending on the context in which it is used. It can refer to engaging in activities for enjoyment or recreation, such as playing a game or playing a musical instrument. Additionally, "play" can also mean performing in a theatrical production or taking on a role in a dramatic performance.
examplePhrases: Children love to play at the park.
She plays the piano beautifully.
I enjoy playing video games in my free time.
The actors will perform in a play at the theater.
Let's play a game of soccer together.

explaining: In English, the word "government" refers to the system or group of people that control a country, state, or organization. It is responsible for making and enforcing laws, managing public affairs, and providing services to its citizens. Governments can take various forms, such as democracies, monarchies, or dictatorships.
examplePhrases: The government is responsible for making laws and policies.
The government provides public services such as healthcare and education.
Citizens pay taxes to the government to fund public projects.
The government is made up of elected officials who represent the people.
Government agencies work together to ensure the safety and well-being of the population.

explaining: The word "run" in English has multiple meanings depending on the context in which it is used. It can refer to the act of moving swiftly on foot, managing or operating something, an unbroken series or sequence of something, or even a liquid substance flowing in a particular direction. It is a versatile word with various uses in the English language.
examplePhrases: I need to run to the store to buy some groceries.
The students decided to run for student council positions.
The water in the sink started to run slowly.
I like to run in the park every morning for exercise.
The business has been profitable and continues to run smoothly.

explaining: The word "small" in English is an adjective used to describe the size of something that is little in comparison to other objects or beings. It typically implies a lack of physical dimensions and is opposite of big or large. It can be used to describe anything from objects, animals, people, to concepts or ideas.
examplePhrases: She lives in a small apartment.
Please give me a small piece of cake.
The small dog barked loudly.
My brother has a small car.
Can you write your name in small letters?

explaining: In English, the word "number" can refer to a quantity or count of things or people. It can also represent a numeral or symbol used in counting or arithmetic. Additionally, "number" can be used to indicate a particular item within a series or list.
examplePhrases: Please write your phone number on the form.
There are a large number of students in the classroom.
I can't remember the number for the security code.
The house is located at number 25 on the street.
The company has a limited number of available positions.

explaining: In English, the word "off" can have various meanings depending on the context. It is commonly used to indicate a position or direction away from a place or point, such as "She walked off into the distance." It can also mean not operating or functioning, as in "The lights are off." Additionally, "off" can be used to show a decrease or reduction, for example, "The price is 20% off."
examplePhrases: Turn off the lights before leaving the room.
She took the day off work to go to the doctor's appointment.
He accidentally knocked the picture frame off the shelf.
The teacher told the students to take their hats off during class.
I can't believe he cut me off while I was speaking.

explaining: "Always" is an adverb that means at all times or on every occasion. It is used to indicate a continuous or constant occurrence of an action or state. For example, "I always brush my teeth before bed" means that the person consistently brushes their teeth before going to sleep.
examplePhrases: I always wake up early in the morning.
She always forgets to bring her phone with her.
He always wears a suit to work.
They always go for a walk after dinner.
We always have dinner together as a family.

explaining: The word "move" in English can have several meanings, depending on the context. It can refer to physically changing one's location or position, such as moving from one place to another. It can also signify an emotional or psychological shift, like moving on from a past experience or changing one's perspective.
examplePhrases: I need to move the furniture to clean the floor.
She made a sudden move towards the door.
Please move aside so others can pass.
The company plans to move to a new location next month.
The dance performance was so captivating, it really moved me.

explaining: "Night" in English refers to the period of darkness between sunset and sunrise when most people typically sleep. It is the opposite of day and is a natural part of the Earth's rotation cycle. During the night, the sky becomes dark and stars and the moon become visible.
examplePhrases: I love going for a walk at night.
The stars shine brightly in the night sky.
We are having a party on Saturday night.
He couldn't sleep well last night.
The night was cold and silent.

explaining: The word "live" has multiple meanings in English, depending on the context in which it is used. It can refer to being alive or not being dead, as in "I want to live a long and healthy life." It can also refer to experiencing something in real-time, such as watching a live performance or live broadcast.
examplePhrases: I live in New York City.
She loves to live life to the fullest.
The concert will be broadcast live on TV.
I live for moments like these.
They plan to live abroad for a year.

explaining: In English, the word "point" can have various meanings depending on the context in which it is used. It can refer to a specific detail or fact, a particular stage or moment in a process, or a sharp end or tip of an object. The word "point" is versatile and can be applied in different situations to convey nuance or emphasis.
examplePhrases: Can you please point out the location on the map?
She made a good point during the meeting.
I don't understand the point you're trying to make.
His presentation was on point.
The compass needle always points north.

explaining: The word "believe" in English means to accept something as true or real without absolute proof. It involves having confidence in the truth, existence, or reliability of something, whether it be an idea, statement, or person. Believing often involves a strong conviction or faith in something that cannot be physically proven.
examplePhrases: I believe in you and your abilities.
Many people believe in the power of positive thinking.
I believe that honesty is the best policy.
Do you believe in ghosts?
Some scientists believe in the existence of parallel universes.

explaining: The word "hold" in English has multiple meanings depending on the context it is used in. Common meanings include to grasp or grip something firmly with your hand, to have or own something, to keep something in a specific position or state, or to organize or host an event or meeting.
examplePhrases: Please hold this package for me until I can pick it up tomorrow.
He had to hold back his tears during the emotional speech.
I need to find a sturdy rope to hold up this heavy mirror on the wall.
Can you hold the door open for me as I bring in these groceries?
The company will hold a meeting next week to discuss upcoming projects.

explaining: "Today" is an adverb that refers to the current day or the day in progress at the moment of speaking. It is used to indicate the present time, distinguishing it from the past or future. For example, in the sentence "I am going to the store today," "today" specifies that the action of going to the store is happening on the current day.
examplePhrases: I have a meeting today at 3 PM.
Today is a beautiful day to go for a walk.
I need to finish my homework today.
What are your plans for today?
Today I am going to try a new recipe for dinner.

explaining: "Bring" in English means to carry or convey something or someone to a place. It is used when indicating a movement towards the speaker's location. This word implies the action of transporting or causing something to come along with oneself.
examplePhrases: Please bring your textbooks to class tomorrow.
I will bring the cake to the party.
Can you bring me a glass of water?
Don't forget to bring your umbrella, it might rain.
She always brings a positive attitude to the team.

explaining: The word "happen" in English means to take place or occur, typically by chance or unexpectedly. It is used to describe an event or occurrence that comes to pass. "Happen" can also refer to something that is experienced or encountered by someone.
examplePhrases: I don't know what will happen tomorrow.
Did you hear about what happened at the party last night?
Accidents can happen at any time.
It's hard to predict what will happen in the future.
Good things can happen when you least expect them.

explaining: "Next" in English is used to refer to the following person, item, or event in a sequence. It indicates something that is coming immediately after the present moment or something that is about to happen. It can also express the idea of being adjacent or nearby in space or time.
examplePhrases: I will see you next Monday for our meeting.
Next time, please remember to bring your textbook to class.
The next train to arrive will be heading to London.
She will be presenting her project next week.
I am looking forward to the next chapter of this book.

explaining: "Without" is a preposition in English that indicates the absence or lack of something. It is commonly used to show that something is missing or not present. For example, "I can't imagine life without you" means that the speaker cannot imagine their life if the other person is not a part of it.
examplePhrases: I can't live without my morning coffee.
The children played outside without any supervision.
She managed to complete the project without any help.
He couldn't imagine a world without music.
They walked through the park without getting wet in the rain.

explaining: "Before" is a preposition that indicates something that comes earlier in time or place. It is used to refer to a point or period of time preceding a particular event or moment. In a sentence, it can express the idea of an action or event happening prior to another action or event.
examplePhrases: I had never traveled abroad before.
Please finish your homework before dinner.
He always liked to read the book before watching the movie adaptation.
The meeting starts at 3 PM, so please arrive a few minutes before.
I had met her once before at a party.

explaining: The word "large" in English typically refers to something that is big in size or extent. It can be used to describe physical dimensions like a large building or a large shirt, as well as quantities such as a large number or a large amount. In a more figurative sense, "large" can also imply significance or importance, such as having a large impact on a situation.
examplePhrases: The large elephant was roaming in the savanna.
She bought a large pizza for the party.
Their new house has a large backyard.
The company is known for producing large quantities of furniture.
He needed a large suitcase for all his clothes.

explaining: The word "million" is a numerical term used to represent the quantity of one thousand thousands or 1,000,000. It is often used to express very large amounts or quantities, such as household income in the millions of dollars or the number of people living in a city. The term "million" is derived from the Latin word "mille," meaning a thousand.
examplePhrases: The company made a million dollars in profit last year.
There are over a million people living in the city.
She won a million dollars in the lottery.
The artist's new album sold a million copies in its first week.
It will take a million seconds for the clock to reach midnight.

explaining: The word "must" is a modal verb in English that is used to express obligation, necessity, or strong recommendation. It indicates that something is required or highly advisable to be done. For example, "You must wear your seatbelt while driving" shows a mandatory action that should be followed.
examplePhrases: You must wear a seatbelt while driving.
Students must submit their assignments by the deadline.
I must remember to buy groceries on my way home.
We must be at the airport two hours before our flight.
He must study hard if he wants to pass the exam.

explaining: "Home" in English refers to the place where someone lives or resides, where they feel comfortable and secure. It is commonly associated with a physical dwelling but can also represent a sense of belonging or a place where one can be themselves. Home can evoke feelings of warmth, safety, and familiarity.
examplePhrases: I can't wait to go home after a long day at work.
Home is where the heart is.
Make yourself at home.
They built a new home in the countryside.
The concert felt like a second home to me.

explaining: "Under" is a preposition that typically signifies a lower position or a state of being beneath or below something else. It can also indicate a position that is covered or hidden by something. In addition, "under" can express a lesser degree or amount of something compared to a specified level or limit.
examplePhrases: The book is under the table.
The cat is hiding under the bed.
She found her keys under the couch.
The grocery store is located under the office building.
The tunnel runs under the river.

explaining: The word "water" refers to the clear, odorless, tasteless liquid essential for the survival of all living organisms. It is a compound made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom (H2O) and is necessary for various biological processes, hydration, and sustainability of life on Earth.
examplePhrases: I drink a glass of water every morning.
The plants need water to grow.
The lake is filled with clear blue water.
Please remember to water the garden before you leave.
She enjoys swimming in the crystal-clear water of the ocean.

explaining: In English, the word "room" typically refers to a space contained within a building that is used for a specific purpose, such as living, dining, or sleeping. It can also denote an area that is set aside for a particular function or activity, like a conference room or a classroom. "Room" can also be used more abstractly to describe an opportunity for maneuvering, freedom, or accommodation.
examplePhrases: I need to clean my room before my friends come over.
There is not enough room in the car for all of us to fit comfortably.
Please reserve a conference room for our meeting tomorrow.
Can you make room for one more person at your dinner table?
The hotel room had a beautiful view of the beach.

explaining: The word "write" in English means to put thoughts, ideas, or information down on paper or in a digital format using a pen, pencil, keyboard, or other writing tool. It involves forming letters, words, and sentences to create written communication. Writing is a fundamental skill used for various purposes such as storytelling, academic research, professional communication, and personal expression.
examplePhrases: Please write your name on the top of the page.
She likes to write poetry in her free time.
Don't forget to write a thank you note to your teacher.
I have to write a report for my boss by tomorrow.
Can you write down the directions so we don't get lost?

explaining: The word "mother" in English refers to a female parent who has given birth to or raised a child. A mother is typically responsible for nurturing and caring for her children, providing love, support, and guidance. In many cultures, mothers are revered for their selfless dedication to their families.
examplePhrases: My mother always cooks delicious meals for the family.
I called my mother to wish her a happy birthday.
She is like a second mother to me, always offering support and guidance.
The mother bird built a nest to protect her eggs.
Mother Nature provides us with beauty and resources to sustain life.

explaining: In English, the word "area" typically refers to a defined space or region. It can be used to describe a specific geographic location, a place within a building, or a particular topic of study. Understanding the concept of "area" helps us to identify and define different spaces and dimensions in various contexts.
examplePhrases: Please clean up the living room area before the guests arrive.
The park has a designated picnic area for visitors.
This shopping mall has a large food court area with various dining options.
The research team focused on studying wildlife in the coastal area.
The teacher divided the classroom into different activity areas for group work.

explaining: The word "national" in English refers to something that relates to a specific country or nation. It can be used to describe things that are characteristic or representative of a particular country, such as national holidays or national pride. "National" can also refer to policies, organizations, or relationships that involve the entire country as a whole.
examplePhrases: I am proud to be a citizen of this national park.
The national anthem plays before every game.
The national holiday is celebrated by people across the country.
The team won the national championship for the third year in a row.
The national government announced new policies to improve healthcare.

explaining: "Money" is a noun that refers to currency or any form of payment that is accepted as a medium of exchange for goods and services. It is used to buy goods, pay bills, and fulfill financial obligations. In essence, money represents value and serves as a means of economic transaction.
examplePhrases: I need to save more money for my vacation.
Can you lend me some money until I get paid?
Money can't buy happiness, but it sure helps.
I won't go shopping today, I'm trying to save money.
He donated a large sum of money to charity.

explaining: In English, the word "story" typically refers to a narrative, account, or tale that is told, often involving characters, events, and a plot. It can be both fictional and non-fictional, and is often used to entertain, inform, or inspire others. Stories can take various forms, such as short stories, novels, fairy tales, or anecdotes.
examplePhrases: I love reading a good story before bed.
Her story about traveling to Japan was so interesting.
The news story on TV was quite shocking.
The children sat in a circle and listened to the teacher tell a story.
She is writing a fictional story for a writing contest.

explaining: The word "young" in English is an adjective used to describe someone who is in the early part of their life or career, typically not yet fully grown or developed. It can also refer to something that is recent, fresh, or new in relation to time or age. In general, "young" is often associated with qualities like vitality, energy, and growth.
examplePhrases: She is a talented young musician.
The young boy ran quickly to catch up with his friends.
The young couple fell in love at first sight.
We have a lot of hope for the young generation.
The young trees in the forest are growing rapidly.

explaining: In English, the word "fact" refers to a statement or assertion that can be proven to be true or accurate. It is a piece of information that is known to be true based on evidence or experience. Facts are objective and can be verified through research or observation.
examplePhrases: It is a fact that the sun rises in the east.
One fact we know for sure is that water freezes at 0 degrees Celsius.
The fact that she is a talented singer is well-known.
There is no denying the fact that climate change is a pressing issue.
She presented evidence to support her claim, turning it into a proven fact.

explaining: In English, the word "month" refers to a unit of time that is approximately four weeks long, typically corresponding to a division of the year based on the lunar cycle. There are 12 months in a year, each with varying lengths ranging from 28 to 31 days. The word "month" is derived from the Old English word "monaþ," which itself comes from the Proto-Germanic word "mēnṓþs."
examplePhrases: There are 12 months in a year.
My birthday is next month.
I have been working here for three months.
The project deadline is in two months.
She will be traveling for a few months.

explaining: "Different" is an adjective in English that is used to describe things that are not the same as each other. It indicates a distinction or variation between two or more objects, ideas, or individuals. When something is described as "different," it means that it is unique, separate, or distinct in some way.
examplePhrases: I enjoy trying different types of cuisine from around the world.
Each student has a different learning style.
We come from different cultural backgrounds.
The two paintings exhibit different styles.
The siblings have very different personalities.

explaining: In English, the word "lot" has multiple meanings depending on the context. It can refer to a piece of land, as in "empty lot" or "parking lot." It can also mean a large number or amount of something, such as "a lot of people" or "a lot of money." Additionally, "lot" can be used to express fate or destiny, like in the phrase "he drew the short lot."
examplePhrases: There is a lot of traffic on the highway.
I have a lot of homework to do tonight.
She has a lot of experience in the field of engineering.
We don't have a lot of time left to finish this project.
I enjoyed the movie a lot.

explaining: In English, the word "study" can be both a verb and a noun. As a verb, it means to devote time and attention to gaining knowledge by researching, reading, practicing, or being taught a subject. As a noun, it refers to the act of engaging in this process of learning or to a specific area of investigation or research.
examplePhrases: I need to study for my biology exam.
She spends hours studying in the library.
It's important to create a quiet study environment.
I have a lot of material to study for the history test.
He decided to pursue further study in computer science.

explaining: In English, the word "book" generally refers to a written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers. It can also indicate a literary work or a collection of information on a particular subject. "Book" can be used as a noun or a verb, depending on the context in which it is used.
examplePhrases: I love to read a good book before bed.
She borrowed a book from the library.
He decided to book a table at the restaurant for dinner.
The teacher asked the students to bring their textbooks to class.
I need to book a flight for my vacation next week.

explaining: In English, the word "eye" refers to the organ in the body responsible for the sense of sight. It is typically located on the face, within the eye socket, and plays a crucial role in how human beings perceive the world around them. The eyes are also commonly referred to as the windows to the soul in various literary and poetic contexts.
examplePhrases: Keep an eye on your belongings.
She couldn't believe her eyes when she saw the surprise party.
He was the apple of her eye.
I have my eye on that new job opening.
The detective had a sharp eye for detail.

explaining: In English, the word "job" typically refers to regular work that a person does to earn money. It can also refer to a specific task or duty that needs to be done. A job can be full-time or part-time and may involve a range of responsibilities and skills.
examplePhrases: I have a new job starting next week.
She did a great job on her presentation.
Finding a job in this market is challenging.
I applied to several jobs online.
It's important to have a good work-life balance in your job.

explaining: In English, the word "word" can refer to a single distinct unit of language that carries meaning and can stand alone or be combined with other words to form sentences. It is the basic building block of communication and is essential for conveying thoughts, ideas, and information. Understanding the meaning and usage of words is crucial for effective communication in any language.
examplePhrases: Please spell that word for me.
I'm looking up the definition of this word in the dictionary.
His word is always reliable and trustworthy.
Do you have a word count requirement for this essay?
I have just one word for that performance: amazing!

explaining: The word "though" is generally used as a conjunction to introduce a contrast or concession between two clauses. It indicates a contrast in ideas or situations. For example, "She was tired, but she continued working on her project, though."
examplePhrases: I don't usually like spicy food, but I enjoyed that dish though.
She said she would call me back, but I haven't heard from her though.
He's a bit shy, but he's a great listener though.
I didn't get much sleep last night, but I feel surprisingly energetic though.
The movie was long, but it kept my attention though.

explaining: In English, the word "business" refers to an organization or economic system where goods and services are exchanged for money. It can also mean a particular company or enterprise engaged in commercial, industrial, or professional activities. Additionally, "business" can describe the action of making one's living by engaging in commerce or trade.
examplePhrases: She owns her own business selling handmade jewelry.
He has been in the business of photography for over 10 years.
Our company is growing its business internationally.
I have a meeting with a potential business partner tomorrow.
It's important to have a clear business plan before starting a new venture.

explaining: "Four" is a cardinal number in English that represents the quantity of one more than three and one less than five. It is commonly used to indicate the number that comes after three and before five in numerical order. The word "four" is pronounced as /fɔːr/ and is written with the numeral 4.
examplePhrases: I have four apples in my bag.
There are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, fall, and winter.
The meeting will start in four minutes.
She scored four goals in the soccer game.
Can you please pick up four cans of soda from the store?

explaining: The word "issue" has a few different meanings in English. It can refer to a specific topic or subject that is being discussed or debated, such as a social issue or a political issue. "Issue" can also mean a problem or difficulty that needs to be resolved or addressed, like an issue with a product or an issue in a relationship.
examplePhrases: There seems to be an issue with the internet connection.
The company is facing some financial issues.
Let's address the main issues before moving on.
The teacher discussed the key issues in the lesson.
The government is working on resolving the healthcare issue.

explaining: In English, the word "side" refers to one of two or more opposing individuals or groups in a disagreement or conflict, such as being on someone's side. It can also mean a particular aspect or part of something, like the side of a building or the side of a coin. Additionally, "side" can indicate a position or direction, as in walking on the right side of the road.
examplePhrases: Please pass me the salt on the side of the table.
He always sits on the same side of the classroom.
I like to walk on the sunny side of the street.
She argued for the other side of the debate.
Let's discuss this issue from every side before making a decision.

explaining: The word "kind" in English means having a gentle, caring, and considerate nature towards others. It is used to describe someone who shows compassion, generosity, and goodwill. Being kind involves being empathetic and helpful towards others.
examplePhrases: He is a very kind person.
She always has a kind word for everyone.
It was so kind of you to help me with my homework.
The teacher praised the student for their kind gesture.
In times of need, it is important to show kindness to others.

explaining: In English, the word "head" can refer to the upper part of the human body that contains the brain and other important organs. Additionally, "head" can also mean the leader or person in charge of a group or organization. It can also be used to describe the front or top part of something, such as the "head" of a company or the "head" of a bed.
examplePhrases: I have a headache.
She is the head of the company.
Please head straight until you reach the end of the road.
He turned the corner and saw a deer head hanging on the wall.
I can't get this song out of my head.

explaining: The word "far" in English refers to a distance that is great or considerable. It is used to describe a physical or metaphorical distance between two points. "Far" can also indicate a significant extent in terms of time, space, or degree.
examplePhrases: The supermarket is not too far from my house.
How far is the nearest gas station?
I have come from a faraway land.
We have a long way to go, but we'll get there far.
She could see a glimpse of the mountain from afar.

explaining: The word "black" refers to the darkest color due to the absorption of all light. It is commonly associated with power, elegance, formality, and sophistication. In symbolic terms, it can also represent mystery, strength, and authority.
examplePhrases: The cat had shiny black fur.
She wore a stylish black dress to the party.
The night sky was so dark that it appeared black.
He painted his room walls in a deep black color.
The coffee mug was plain black with no design.

explaining: In English, the word "long" is used to describe the measurement of something in the horizontal extent from one end to the other. It can also refer to the passage of a great amount of time, indicating a duration or period of time that is extended. Additionally, "long" can describe the length of something figuratively, such as a "long journey" or "long day."
examplePhrases: The movie was very long and I got a bit bored.
She has long brown hair that reaches down to her waist.
I have been friends with her for a long time.
We had a long discussion about our future plans.
He took the long route to avoid traffic.

explaining: The word "both" in English is used to refer to two items or individuals together, indicating that they are considered as a pair or a unit. It is often used when comparing or discussing two things that are being mentioned in the same context. "Both" implies an inclusive meaning, encompassing both elements in the statement.
examplePhrases: I like both chocolate and vanilla ice cream.
Both Sarah and John got accepted into the university.
The store sells both shoes and handbags.
We can both watch a movie and go for a walk.
She is proficient in both English and Spanish.

explaining: "Little" in English is an adjective that means small in size, quantity, or extent. It is often used to describe things that are not big or significant. Additionally, "little" can also suggest a sense of endearment or affection, as in the phrase "a little puppy."
examplePhrases: I'll have a little bit of cake, please.
He's a little shy when meeting new people.
There's little time left to finish the project.
She lives in a little cottage by the lake.
Just a little more effort and you'll reach your goal.

explaining: In English, the word "house" typically refers to a building where people live. It can be a single-family dwelling or a larger structure containing multiple living units. The word "house" can also be used more broadly to refer to a household or family unit residing together in a home.
examplePhrases: I live in a big house.
We are having a party at John's house.
She painted her house yellow.
The dog ran around the house.
The old house was renovated last year.

explaining: "Yes" is a simple and positive affirmation, often used to express agreement, consent, or confirmation in English. It is the opposite of "no" and is a commonly used word in everyday conversations to indicate a positive response to a question or statement.
examplePhrases: Yes, I would like a cup of tea, please.
Yes, I understand the instructions you gave me.
Yes, I agree with your proposal.
Yes, I can attend the meeting tomorrow.
Yes, I am happy with the progress we have made so far.

explaining: In English, the word "since" is commonly used as a conjunction to indicate the starting point of a specific time or event. It can also denote the reason behind a particular situation or outcome. Additionally, "since" can be used to express the passing of time between two related events or actions.
examplePhrases: I have been studying English since last year.
Since you are here, could you help me with my homework?
I haven't seen him since our high school reunion.
She has been feeling unwell since yesterday.
Since it's raining, we should stay indoors.

explaining: The word "provide" means to supply, furnish, or make available something that is needed or desired. It is often used to indicate giving someone something they require or to offer assistance or support. For example, a teacher provides students with the necessary materials for a lesson.
examplePhrases: The company will provide training for all new employees.
Please provide your full name and date of birth on the application form.
It is important to provide evidence to support your claim.
The hotel will provide complimentary breakfast for guests.
The charity organization aims to provide food and shelter for the homeless.

explaining: The word "service" in English typically refers to the action of helping or doing work for someone. It can also describe a system or organization that provides a particular activity or assistance to others. Additionally, "service" can refer to the act of maintenance or repair on a mechanical or technical device.
examplePhrases: The hotel provides excellent customer service.
I need to take my car in for a service check-up.
She works in the customer service department.
The restaurant had slow service last night.
He is a veteran who served in the military.

explaining: The word "around" is a preposition that commonly indicates movement or position in a circular or surrounding manner. It can also indicate a approximate location or time. For example, "She walked around the park" or "We will meet at around 6 pm."
examplePhrases: I will be around to help you with your homework later.
She likes to hang around with her friends after school.
The cat is somewhere around the house.
Let's walk around the park and enjoy the scenery.
The meeting will start at around 3 o'clock.

explaining: A friend is someone who you have a close and trusting relationship with, who you enjoy spending time with and can rely on for support and companionship. Friends are there to share in your joys and help you through your challenges, creating a sense of belonging and connection in your life. Cultivating and maintaining friendships is an important part of social and emotional well-being.
examplePhrases: I consider her my best friend.
He is always there for me, like a true friend.
I need to talk to a friend about this issue.
She introduced me to her friend from work.
We have been friends since elementary school.

explaining: The word "important" in English refers to something that holds significance, worth, or value. It often denotes the relevance or high level of priority that is assigned to a particular person, thing, or situation. When describing something as important, it indicates that it carries a degree of importance or significance in relation to a specific context or goal.
examplePhrases: It is important to study for your exams.
Please remember to take your important documents with you.
Safety measures are important to follow in the workplace.
It's important to communicate effectively in a team.
Good time management is important for success.

explaining: "Father" is a noun in English that refers to a male parent. He is typically responsible for the care, guidance, and support of his children. Fathers play an important role in the family unit and are often seen as a source of strength and protection.
examplePhrases: My father is a hardworking man.
She inherited her love of gardening from her father.
He always seeks advice from his father before making big decisions.
I look up to my father as a role model.
His father taught him how to ride a bike when he was young.

explaining: The word "sit" in English means to lower oneself onto a chair or other object with one's weight. It can also refer to taking a position on something or being in a particular place. Additionally, "sit" can be used to describe animals such as dogs when they rest in a position with their hind legs bent and their weight supported by their hindquarters.
examplePhrases: Please sit down and make yourself comfortable.
The students need to sit quietly during the exam.
She likes to sit by the window and read her book.
The dog will sit if you command it to.
I prefer to sit on a bench in the park and relax.

explaining: "Away" in English means at a distance from a particular place or person. It can also refer to being absent or not present. Additionally, it can indicate moving or traveling in a particular direction.
examplePhrases: Please put your phone away during class.
The kids ran away from the park when it started raining.
I need to step away from my desk for a moment.
She gazed away into the distance, lost in thought.
The store is just a few blocks away from here.

explaining: The word "until" is a preposition that denotes a point in time when something is expected to happen or must happen before a certain event or action occurs. It indicates the time leading up to a specified moment or outcome, creating a sense of duration or limit. In context, it is often used to show the period of time before reaching a particular result or conclusion.
examplePhrases: I will wait until you finish your work.
Please remain seated until the movie has ended.
You can play outside until it gets dark.
We have to wait until the rain stops.
She will stay at the party until midnight.

explaining: The word "power" in English refers to the ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way. It can also denote authority, control, or influence over others or a situation. In a broader sense, power can encompass strength, energy, and force in various contexts.
examplePhrases: She has a lot of power in the company.
The storm knocked out the power in the entire town.
He used his power to influence the decision.
Knowledge is power.
The power went out during the thunderstorm.

explaining: The word "hour" in English refers to a unit of time equivalent to 60 minutes, typically used to measure the duration of an activity or a specific time of day. It is a fundamental unit for measuring time in various contexts such as scheduling, work hours, and timekeeping. An hour is further divided into 60 minutes and is a key component of the standardized time system.
examplePhrases: I have an appointment in half an hour.
The movie starts in one hour.
Can you finish this task in two hours?
She worked for several hours on the project.
He arrived early, so he had to wait for an hour before the meeting.

explaining: The word "game" in English typically refers to an enjoyable activity or type of play that often involves competition, rules, and skill. It can also refer to a form of entertainment or a recreational pastime that brings pleasure and enjoyment. In a broader sense, "game" can also be used metaphorically to describe a strategic activity, manipulation, or a challenge in various aspects of life.
examplePhrases: I love playing video games in my free time.
Let's go to the park and play a game of soccer.
She is very competitive and always wants to win at games.
The board game we played last night was so much fun.
He is a professional gamer and competes in gaming tournaments.

explaining: "Often" is an adverb used to indicate that something happens frequently or on a regular basis. It implies a high frequency of occurrence. For example, "I often go for a walk in the evenings" means that the person goes for a walk frequently or regularly.
examplePhrases: I often go for a walk in the park.
She often visits her grandparents on weekends.
They often have meetings in the afternoon.
He often forgets his keys at home.
We often eat dinner together as a family.

explaining: "Yet" is a conjunction that is used to link contrasting or opposing ideas. It often indicates something that is expected to happen, but has not happened up to a certain point in time. It can also be used to emphasize a contrast or contradiction in a statement.
examplePhrases: I haven't finished my homework yet.
Have you eaten breakfast yet?
The results of the test haven't been announced yet.
I haven't decided on a movie to watch yet.
He hasn't returned my call yet.

explaining: In English, the word "line" can have several meanings depending on the context. It can refer to a long, narrow mark or band, such as a straight geometric figure, or a way of marking boundaries or separating one area from another. Additionally, "line" can also refer to a sequence of related things or a row of words in writing or speech.
examplePhrases: Please stand in line for your turn.
She drew a straight line on the paper.
The bakery has a long line of customers waiting to buy bread.
I need to memorize my lines for the school play.
Let's go see that new movie everyone is talking about, I heard it has some great one-liners.

explaining: The term "political" refers to anything related to government, public affairs, or the activities and decisions of elected officials or political parties. It can also describe actions or behaviors that are influenced by or involved in the process of governing a country or community. Overall, the term "political" pertains to the organization and management of power within a society.
examplePhrases: She is involved in political activism.
The political situation in the country is unstable.
The candidate's political views are well-known.
The decision was made for political reasons.
The government is facing political pressure from various groups.

explaining: The word "end" in English refers to the conclusion or final part of something. It can signify the termination of a process, activity, or event. "End" can also refer to a boundary or limit of something.
examplePhrases: The movie has a surprising twist at the end.
She waved goodbye until the very end of the street.
Please complete this task by the end of the day.
The book's conclusion brought a satisfying end to the story.
He decided to end the argument before it escalated further.

explaining: The word "among" in English is a preposition that is used to indicate being surrounded by or in the midst of a group of people or things. It implies belonging to a larger group or being part of a set of options or choices. It is often used to show a sense of inclusion or distribution within a larger context.
examplePhrases: She was considered the best dancer among the group.
The study found a link between smoking and cancer among adults.
He stood out as a leader among his peers.
There was a sense of camaraderie among the team members.
The painting stood out among the other artwork in the gallery.

explaining: The word "ever" is an adverb that is used to ask if something has occurred at any time in the past, present, or future. It is often used in questions or to add emphasis to a statement. For example, "Have you ever been to Paris?" or "This is the best movie I have ever seen."
examplePhrases: Have you ever been to Paris?
This is the best movie ever!
Did you ever finish reading that book?
Have you ever tried sushi before?
She is the most talented singer ever.

explaining: In English, the word "stand" can be used as a verb meaning to be in or maintain an upright position on the feet. It can also mean to have a particular attitude or position on an issue. Additionally, "stand" can refer to a structure on which objects can be placed or displayed.
examplePhrases: Please stand up when the teacher enters the room.
I can't stand the way he always interrupts me.
The old barn has been standing for over a century.
I won't stand for this kind of behavior in my classroom.
She took a stand against discrimination in the workplace.

explaining: In English, the word "bad" generally refers to something that is not good or of poor quality. It can describe something that is harmful, unpleasant, undesirable, or lacking in excellence. Depending on the context, it can be used to express disapproval or criticism about a person, object, situation, or behavior.
examplePhrases: I had a bad day at work today.
The storm caused bad damage to the house.
Eating junk food is bad for your health.
She has a bad habit of always being late.
I felt really bad about missing her birthday party.

explaining: "Lose" in English means to no longer possess something that you previously had, or fail to win a game, competition, or argument. It is the opposite of "win" or "keep," and is often used to describe misplacing objects or experiencing a defeat.
examplePhrases: I don't want to lose this opportunity.
If you don't study, you will lose marks in the exam.
She was afraid to lose her job.
Try not to lose your keys again.
He tends to lose focus during long meetings.

explaining: The word "however" is an adverb used to introduce a contrasting or surprising statement. It is often used to show a deviation or contradiction from what has been said previously. "However" can also be used to introduce a new idea or point that contrasts with the previous information.
examplePhrases: I wanted to go for a run; however, it started raining heavily.
She studied hard for the exam; however, she didn't perform well.
The restaurant had great reviews; however, the food was disappointing.
He promised to finish the project on time; however, he missed the deadline.
The movie received critical acclaim; however, not everyone enjoyed it.

explaining: In English, the word "member" typically refers to a person who belongs to a group or organization. It can also refer to a part or component of something such as a body or structure. For example, a member of a club, team, or family is someone who is part of that specific group.
examplePhrases: He is a valued member of our team.
She has been a member of the club for several years.
Each member of the group has a specific role to play.
As a member of the organization, you are entitled to certain benefits.
Please welcome our newest member to the class.

explaining: "Pay" in English refers to giving money or another form of compensation in exchange for goods, services, or work. It often involves transferring funds to someone for a product or service that has been provided. The concept of "pay" is a fundamental aspect of economic transactions and employment relationships.
examplePhrases: I need to pay the bills before the due date.
She paid for her groceries with cash.
He will pay for his mistakes.
I always pay attention in class.
We should pay our respects to those who have passed away.

explaining: In English, the word "law" typically refers to a system of rules and regulations that are set by a government or authority to govern a society. Laws are designed to maintain order, enforce justice, and protect the rights and well-being of individuals within a community. Compliance with these legal guidelines is necessary to ensure a functioning and just societal framework.

The word "meet" can have several meanings in English. It is commonly used to describe coming together or encountering someone or something at a specific time and place. It can also refer to fulfilling or satisfying a particular requirement or standard. Overall, "meet" is a versatile verb that can denote a range of actions and situations related to encountering, satisfying, or fulfilling something.
examplePhrases: Let's meet for lunch tomorrow
I will meet you at the library at 3 pm
We are scheduled to meet with the client next week
I hope to meet your parents soon
The team will meet to discuss the project later today

explaining: A "car" is a motor vehicle with four wheels typically designed to carry a small number of passengers. It is commonly used for transportation and is powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor. Cars come in various sizes, shapes, and models to suit different needs and preferences.
examplePhrases: I need to fill up my car with gas.
She drives a red convertible car.
My dream car is a Tesla.
He parked his car in the garage.
The car dealership is having a sale this weekend.

explaining: A "city" is a large and highly populated urban area that serves as a center of commerce, culture, and government. It typically has well-developed infrastructure, such as buildings, roads, and public services. Cities are important hubs of activity and innovation in society.
examplePhrases: New York City is known for its fast-paced lifestyle.
They decided to explore the historic city of Rome.
The city skyline lit up beautifully at night.
London is a diverse and multicultural city.
Tokyo is a bustling city with a mix of traditional and modern vibes.

explaining: "Almost" is an adverb commonly used to indicate that something is very close to happening or being true but did not quite reach that point. It is used to suggest nearly or nearly but not quite. For example, "She almost missed her flight."
examplePhrases: I am almost done with my homework.
She was almost late for the meeting.
The store is almost closed for the day.
We're almost at the finish line.
The project is almost complete.

explaining: The word "include" in English means to contain as part of a whole, or to consider as part of a group. It suggests that something or someone is part of a larger category or collective. When something is included, it is incorporated or comprised within a specified set or grouping.
examplePhrases: The package will include a variety of snacks and drinks.
Please make sure to include your contact information in the email.
The museum tour will include a visit to the art exhibit.
My job responsibilities include managing the budget and supervising staff.
The ticket price will include access to all attractions in the theme park.

explaining: The word "continue" in English means to persist in an activity or process without interruption. It implies carrying on with something that was previously started or ongoing. It suggests a forward movement or progression without stopping.
examplePhrases: Please continue working on your assignment.
I will continue to study for the exam.
Despite the challenges, she decided to continue with her project.
The meeting will continue tomorrow at the same time.
We must continue to strive for success.

explaining: In English, the word "set" can have several meanings depending on the context. It can refer to a collection of similar items or objects, such as a set of dishes or a set of tools. It can also mean to place something in a particular position or location, or to establish a pattern or standard. Finally, "set" can indicate a group of people or things that are considered as a unit, such as a set of rules or a set of data.
examplePhrases: She set the table for dinner.
He set the alarm clock for 6 AM.
I need to set aside some time for studying.
The teacher set a deadline for the project.
They set a new record in the race.

explaining: "Later" in English is an adverb that indicates a point in time that is after the present or the time being referred to. It can be used to suggest a specific time in the future when something will happen or to refer to a time that comes after another event. "Later" can also be used informally to mean "goodbye" or "see you later."
examplePhrases: I will call you later.
Let's discuss this later.
I can meet you later today.
She said she would finish the report later.
We can decide on that later.

explaining: The term "community" refers to a group of people living in a specific area or sharing common characteristics, interests, or goals. It can also denote a feeling of fellowship with others as a result of sharing common attitudes, interests, and goals. Essentially, a community is a group of individuals who come together to support and engage with one another.
examplePhrases: The community came together to support the local food bank.
As a member of the community, it is important to participate in town meetings.
The online community offers a platform for like-minded individuals to connect.
The school community organized a fundraising event for a student in need.
Volunteering is a great way to give back to the community.

explaining: In English, the word "name" refers to the label or title by which an entity, such as a person, place, or thing, is known or identified. This could be a given name, a proper noun, or any other label used to distinguish and refer to an individual or object. Names often have personal or cultural significance and are used for identification and communication purposes.
examplePhrases: What is your name?
Can you please write your name on the form?
His name is John.
I heard your name mentioned in the meeting.
She doesn't want me to mention her name.

explaining: In English, the word "five" is a cardinal number that represents the quantity or value of 5. It is used to count or indicate the position of the fifth item in a series. The word "five" is derived from Old English "fīf" and is commonly used in everyday language for counting, telling time, marking dates, and more.
examplePhrases: I have five apples.
She celebrated her fifth birthday last week.
There are five days left until the deadline.
He scored a perfect five on the exam.
The team consists of five members.

explaining: The word "once" in English is an adverb that typically means "one time" or "on one occasion." It is often used to indicate a singular past event or moment in time. Additionally, "once" can also be used to express the idea of something happening as soon as another condition is met.
examplePhrases: I only visited Paris once in my life.
Once you understand the instructions, you can begin the task.
I used to be a picky eater, but once I tried sushi, I loved it.
She was a great musician once, but she no longer plays the violin.
Once upon a time, there was a magical kingdom in the forest.

explaining: The word "white" refers to the color that reflects light of all hues, with no absorption. It is typically associated with purity, innocence, and cleanliness. In terms of race, it is used to describe people of European descent.
examplePhrases: She wore a beautiful white dress to the party.
The snow-covered mountains looked so white against the blue sky.
I love the clean look of white walls in a room.
The chef prepared a delicious dish with white truffle oil.
The bride carried a bouquet of white roses down the aisle.

explaining: The word "least" is a comparative adjective that indicates the smallest amount or degree of something among a group of things or people. It is used to show the lowest level or rank in a scale or hierarchy. In a sentence, "least" is often used to compare items and highlight the one that has the smallest quantity, importance, or significance.
examplePhrases: I have the least experience in this field.
She is the least likely to arrive on time.
This is the least expensive option available.
He ate the least amount of food at the party.
This book is the least interesting out of the series.

explaining: In English, the word "president" refers to the head of a country or organization, usually elected by popular vote or appointed to lead. The president is responsible for making important decisions, representing the organization or country on a national and international level, and overseeing the implementation of policies. The role of a president can vary depending on the specific organization or country in which they serve.
examplePhrases: The president of the company announced a new initiative.
The president of the United States delivered a speech.
She aspires to become the president of the student council.
The president of the club organized a fundraiser.
The president of the organization welcomed new members.

explaining: "Learn" in English is a verb that means to acquire knowledge or skills through studying, instruction, or experience. When we learn something, we gain information and understanding about a subject or topic that was previously unknown to us. Learning is a continuous process that involves absorbing new information, practicing new skills, and integrating knowledge into our existing understanding.
examplePhrases: I want to learn how to play the guitar.
She learns a new word every day.
We can learn a lot from history.
They are eager to learn about different cultures.
It's never too late to learn something new.

explaining: The word "real" in English typically refers to something that exists objectively or in fact, as opposed to being imaginary or fictional. It can also be used to describe something that is genuine or authentic, rather than artificial or fake. In a broader sense, "real" can convey a sense of truthfulness, reality, or authenticity in various contexts.
examplePhrases: She wanted to find a real solution to the problem.
He is a real expert in his field.
Let's be real, that excuse is just not going to cut it.
I can't believe this is real, it feels like a dream.
She showed her real emotions during the performance.

explaining: In English, the word "change" is a noun that refers to the act or process of making something different. It can also be used as a verb to describe the action of altering or transforming something. Overall, "change" encompasses the idea of variation, modification, or adjustment in different contexts.
examplePhrases: I need to change my clothes before we go out.
The seasons change throughout the year.
Can you spare some change for the parking meter?
She decided to change her hairstyle for a new look.
I want to make a positive change in my life.

explaining: In English, the word "team" refers to a group of individuals working together toward a common goal or objective. It emphasizes collaboration, cooperation, and unity among its members to achieve success. Teams often consist of people with complementary skills and strengths who support each other in their endeavors.
examplePhrases: Our team worked together to complete the project on time.
She is a valuable member of the sales team.
The soccer team won the championship last year.
Teamwork is essential for success in any organization.
The management team is meeting to discuss the new strategy.

explaining:
The word "minute" in English can have two different meanings:

1. As an adjective, "minute" means something very small or tiny in size.
2. As a noun, "minute" can also refer to a unit of time equal to 60 seconds.

So, depending on the context, "minute" could refer to something small in size or a specific unit of time.
examplePhrases: I'll be ready in a minute.
Wait a minute, I need to finish this first.
The meeting will start in just a few minutes.
Can you spare a minute to help me with this?
She arrived at the last minute.

explaining: The word "best" in English is used to refer to something that is of the highest quality or most excellence among a group of similar things. It can indicate superiority or excellence in comparison to others. "Best" can also be used to express preference or approval for a specific option or choice.
examplePhrases: She is the best singer in the choir.
I always do my best on exams.
This restaurant has the best pizza in town.
Watching the sunset at the beach is the best way to relax.
I want only the best for my children.

explaining: "Several" means more than two but not many. It typically refers to a small number of things, people, or items. It suggests a quantity that is more than a few but less than many.
examplePhrases: I have several books that I need to read.
She visited several countries in Europe last summer.
There are several options for you to choose from.
He completed several tasks before the deadline.
The store sells several brands of clothing.
