explaining: In English, the word "idea" refers to a thought or concept that exists in the mind. It can encompass plans, suggestions, or beliefs that one may have. Ideas are often the basis for creativity, problem-solving, and communication.
examplePhrases: I really like your idea for the project.
Do you have any idea what time the meeting starts?
She came up with a brilliant idea for the fundraiser.
I have no idea where I left my keys.
That's a great idea! Let's go for a hike this weekend.

explaining: The word "kid" in English is a colloquial term for a child or a young person, typically used to refer to someone in a playful or informal way. It can also be used as a verb meaning to joke or tease someone. In some contexts, "kid" can also refer to a baby goat.
examplePhrases: The kids are playing in the backyard.
I have three kids, two boys and a girl.
He is just a kid, so be patient with him.
The teacher asked the kids to line up for lunch.
She enjoys volunteering with underprivileged kids.

explaining: In English, the word "body" most commonly refers to the physical structure of a human or animal, including the organs, limbs, and other parts. It can also refer to the main part of a book or document. Additionally, "body" can be used figuratively to mean a group of individuals or a collective entity.
examplePhrases: She has a slim body.
Exercise is good for the body.
The body of the car was damaged in the accident.
He buried the body in the cemetery.
She felt aches and pains all over her body.

explaining: The word "information" refers to facts or knowledge that are shared, received, or learned. It encompasses data or details that convey meaning or have significance. In a broader sense, information is the communication of knowledge through various forms such as written text, verbal communication, or visual media.
examplePhrases: I need more information about this topic.
The website provides useful information for travelers.
Please keep this information confidential.
She shared valuable information during the meeting.
The book is a great source of information on historical events.

explaining: "Nothing" refers to the absence or lack of something. It is used to indicate the absence of anything or the absence of a specific thing. In English, "nothing" is a pronoun that signifies zero, no quantity, or not anything.
examplePhrases: There is nothing in the fridge.
She said nothing about the party.
You have nothing to worry about.
He felt like nothing could stop him.
I did nothing yesterday.

explaining: "Ago" is an English word that is used to indicate a time period before the present moment. It is often used in reference to how long it has been since a particular event or action occurred. For example, if someone says "I saw that movie two years ago," they are referring to a point in time two years prior to the current moment.
examplePhrases: I moved to this city two years ago.
She finished her project a week ago.
We visited that museum a month ago.
He started working at the company six months ago.
They celebrated their anniversary a year ago.

explaining: The word "lead" has multiple meanings in English. It can refer to being in charge or guiding others, as in a leadership role. It can also refer to a heavy, bluish-gray metal commonly used for pipes and for weights, spelled "lead." Additionally, "lead" can also mean to go in a specific direction or to be at the front of a group.
examplePhrases: The path will lead you to the top of the mountain
She has a confident personality that allows her to lead the team effectively
Please follow the signs that will lead you to the nearest exit
His hard work and dedication will surely lead to success
The detective tried to piece together the clues to lead him to the suspect

explaining: The word "social" in English refers to activities or interactions involving people or society as a whole. It relates to how individuals communicate, interact, or engage with others within a community. "Social" can also describe a person who enjoys or is responsive to social activities and gatherings.
examplePhrases: Social interactions are important for building relationships.
She is very active on social media platforms.
Our school organized a social event for the students.
Being part of a social club can help you meet new people.
The company has a strong commitment to social responsibility.

explaining: In English, "understand" means to comprehend or grasp the meaning of something, typically through knowledge, experience, or reasoning. It refers to the ability to make sense of information or ideas and to form a coherent understanding of a subject. Understanding involves interpreting, acknowledging, and potentially internalizing the details or concepts being communicated.
examplePhrases: I understand your point of view.
Can you help me understand this concept better?
It may take some time to fully understand the instructions.
I don't think you understand the gravity of the situation.
Let me know if you need help understanding the assignment.

explaining: In English, the word "whether" is used as a conjunction to introduce a choice between two possibilities or alternatives. It is often used to indicate a decision or a condition between two options. In a sentence, "whether" typically presents a situation where a selection needs to be made between one option and another.
examplePhrases: I am not sure whether I will attend the party or not.
She couldn't decide whether to order pizza or pasta for dinner.
Please let me know whether you prefer the blue or the red shirt.
They are still debating whether to go on vacation this summer.
I am not sure whether it will rain tomorrow or not.

explaining: The word "watch" can have multiple meanings in English. It can refer to a small timepiece worn on the wrist, used for telling time. "Watch" can also mean to observe or look at something attentively or carefully. Additionally, "watch" can refer to monitoring or standing guard over a person, place, or activity.
examplePhrases: I always wear a watch so I can check the time easily.
He watches the news every evening to stay informed.
Please watch your step on the icy sidewalk.
The security guard will watch the premises throughout the night.
Let's watch a movie together this weekend.

explaining: "Together" in English refers to being in a group or with other people in a unified manner. It signifies unity, cooperation, and harmony among individuals working or being present in the same place or doing an activity collectively. It typically emphasizes the idea of being in close proximity or association with others for a shared purpose or experience.
examplePhrases: Let's work together to solve this problem.
The students always sit together during lunch.
We can achieve great things when we work together.
I enjoy spending time together with my family.
The team celebrated their victory together.

explaining: In English, the word "follow" means to go or come after someone or something, to understand or pay attention to something, or to comply with or act in accordance with a particular set of rules or instructions. It's commonly used in a variety of contexts such as following a person's lead, following instructions, or following a specific path or course of action.
examplePhrases: Please follow the instructions carefully.
I will follow up with you on this matter tomorrow.
I always try to follow my dreams.
You should follow the road until you reach the end.
Do you follow what I'm saying?

explaining: In English, the word "parent" refers to a person who is a father or a mother to a child or children. Parents play a vital role in raising and nurturing their children, providing support, guidance, and love. The term "parent" can be used to describe someone who has biological, adoptive, or caregiving responsibilities for a child.
examplePhrases: My parent is picking me up from school today.
It's important for parents to communicate openly with their children.
She inherited her mother's eyes - a trait passed down from parent to child.
The school encourages parent involvement in their child's education.
As a parent, it's crucial to set a good example for your kids.
